subTitle: and the Web
description: A web page in very basic form contains the structure in itself.

subTitle: .html .js .css
description: html file is content(model), js is controller, css for view
Tell me about it and everything else is just fine.
is it DOM manupilation that we need and thats the only thing ?!

punchLine: All this for maintaining our own application. CODE and DESIGN .
description:
Only DOM manupilation is not enough. Lets say we are done with the view. But then we need a way to manage data(model) and need a way to bind all data and view together (controller).
And that should be as easy as using jQuery.
The jQuery philosophy is nice to follow.

subTitle: essentials
description:
Grid system for CSS.
JS Frameworks for logic
Pre-processors
CoffeeScript for javascript
LESS for CSS


BackboneJS : The framework we will look into now.

subTitle: MV*
description: This is a MV* framework and not MVC.

subTitle: MV*
description: At least not Model, View and Controller. Rather 'c' stands for 'Collection' here in BackboneJS.

subTitle: MV*
punchLine: Model View Collection Events History Router Utility

subTitle: MV*
description: heavy dependency on other frameworks or libraries
